title: ARCS Model-Based Educational Design for Social Welfare Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Statistics Concepts (e.g., Mean, Standard Deviation) and Social Welfare Field Experience
context.additional_context: Practical skills-based training to enhance statistical application abilities in social welfare settings

learning_goals: Learners will be able to apply descriptive statistics (mean, variance, correlation) based on real-world cases encountered in social welfare practice.
Learners will improve interest and confidence in statistics by 80% or more through learning activities designed according to the ARCS model.
Explain the fundamental principles of hypothesis testing and apply them to case studies using materials accessible in mobile environments

resources: Social Welfare Statistics Case Study Video (5-Minute Duration)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
